head.supplied: 4/7/87. ¶ ¶ In one of the journals, which came by last mail, dear Mr Macdonald, all the credit of the new antarctic movement is given to Europe, none to Australia. If you could kindly spare me a copy...

div.p: A38 Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (Vic. Branch) papers, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
In one of the journals, which came by last mail, dear Mr Macdonald, all the credit of the new antarctic movement is given to Europe, none to Australia. If you could kindly spare me a copy of my last adress and any papers of the antarctic committee here, I will enlighten the Editor and others on the subject.
Which journal? Resulting correspondence?
It is particularly unjust to yourself and me, as we moved here for the formation of an antarctic committee.
